A **shield** is a form of [armor](/wiki/Armor "Armor") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, and is one of seven armor slots available to the [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero") and certain [monsters](/wiki/Monster "Monster").

## Description

[Wearing](/wiki/Wear "Wear") a shield requires [hands](/wiki/Hands "Hands"), and is incompatible with wielding a [two-handed weapon](/wiki/Two-handed_weapon "Two-handed weapon") or performing [two weapon combat](/wiki/Two_weapon_combat "Two weapon combat"); wearing a shield also prevents the hero from dealing [staggering blows](/wiki/Staggering_blow "Staggering blow"), and prevents a [Monk](/wiki/Monk "Monk") from receiving a [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") bonus for [martial arts](/wiki/Martial_arts "Martial arts"). While the shield is not designed to be used as a [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon"), there is code that specifies feedback for hitting a monster with a shield.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

Wearing any shield reduces the hero's [spellcasting success rate](/wiki/Spellcasting#Calculating_spell_success_rate "Spellcasting") - the [small shield](/wiki/Small_shield "Small shield") has the lowest reduction.

Any monster with hands that can wear armor and is not wielding a two-handed weapon can wear a shield.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

If the hero or a monster is subject to a blast of [disintegration](/wiki/Disintegration "Disintegration") and they do not have [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection"), any shield they are wearing will be destroyed first without affecting them or their worn body armor.

## List of shields

## Strategy

Any shield that is non-cursed is safe to try on. In the early game, obtaining [armor class](/wiki/Armor_class "Armor class") is a priority, and most shields are useful to that end: the starting +3 small shield of a [Valkyrie](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie") is a significant advantage over other roles, to the point that a non-Valkyrie hero who finds Valkyrie bones often benefits from wearing the shield, even if it is cursed. Monks have more than a few advantages from *not* wearing shields, including better to-hit and staggering blows.

In the mid-game, the relative value of armor class declines enough that most players in roles that can two-weapon (including Valkyries) will gladly give up a few points of AC from their shield for the damage increase - spellcasters focused on constant combat or utility spells may also forgo shields as well.

Popular shield choices from the mid-game to the [ascension run](/wiki/Ascension_run "Ascension run") are:

- [shield of reflection](/wiki/Shield_of_reflection "Shield of reflection") -- [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection") is an important extrinsic property
- small shield -- minimal spellcasting hindrance
- elven shield -- has a niche use for its ability to be safely enchanted to +7

Heroes who keep a strong [pet](/wiki/Pet "Pet") often give them a shield of reflection.

## History

The shield is available as a form of protection as early as Hack 1.21, which is based on [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"), and it is formally made into an armor slot in [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0").

## Variants

Many variants add new types of shield, and some also make it possible to actively utilize shields in combat.

## References

A shield is a form of armor that appears in NetHack, and is one of seven armor slots available to the hero and certain monsters.

Description

Wearing a shield requires hands, and is incompatible with wielding a two-handed weapon or performing two weapon combat; wearing a shield also prevents the hero from dealing staggering blows, and prevents a Monk from receiving a to-hit bonus for martial arts. While the shield is not designed to be used as a weapon, there is code that specifies feedback for hitting a monster with a shield.[1]

Wearing any shield reduces the hero's spellcasting success rate - the small shield has the lowest reduction.

Any monster with hands that can wear armor and is not wielding a two-handed weapon can wear a shield.[2]

If the hero or a monster is subject to a blast of disintegration and they do not have reflection, any shield they are wearing will be destroyed first without affecting them or their worn body armor.

Strategy

Any shield that is non-cursed is safe to try on. In the early game, obtaining armor class is a priority, and most shields are useful to that end: the starting +3 small shield of a Valkyrie is a significant advantage over other roles, to the point that a non-Valkyrie hero who finds Valkyrie bones often benefits from wearing the shield, even if it is cursed. In the mid-game, the relative value of armor class declines enough that most players in roles that can two-weapon (including Valkyries) will gladly give up a few points of AC from their shield for the damage increase - spellcasters focused on constant combat or utility spells may also forgo shields as well.

  • shield of reflection -- reflection is an important extrinsic property
